ticket.translation[0].definitions[0].def: a printed piece of paper which shows that you have paid to enter a cinema, travel on a bus, plane etc
ticket.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: How much are tickets for the concert?
I’d like two tickets to Berlin.
a ticket to watch the US Open
ticket.translation[0].definitions[1].def: a printed piece of paper with a number on it that you buy because you will get a prize if that number is chosen
ticket.translation[0].definitions[2].def: a printed note ordering you to pay money because you have done something illegal while driving or parking your car
ticket.translation[0].definitions[3].def: a piece of paper fastened to something in a shop that shows its price, size etc
ticket.translation[0].definitions[3].exa: How much does it say on the price ticket?
ticket.translation[0].definitions[4].def: a list of the people supported by a particular political party in an election
ticket.translation[0].definitions[4].exa: He ran for governor on the Republican ticket.
ticket.translation[0].note_box[0].sectio: You can pick up your airline tickets at the check-in desk.
The special rate includes theatre tickets and transport from the hotel to the theatre.
I bought a one-way ticket to London.
How much is a round trip ticket to Boston?
He has a season ticket for Manchester United.
You cannot travel without a valid ticket.
We booked our tickets well in advance.
Sheila bought a ticket for the next flight home.
There was a long queue at the ticket office.
The ticket machine wasn’t issuing tickets.
John insisted on carrying my case as far as the ticket barrier.
Book your tickets online from one of the many ticket agencies.
ticket.translation[0].note_box[1].sectio: a ticket that lets you go to a place but not back again
He bought a one-way ticket to Los Angeles.
a ticket that lets you go to a place and back again
a ticket that lets you make the same journey every day for a fixed period of time
My company pays for my season ticket.
a ticket that you buy over the Internet, in which you are given a number which you use when you check in at an airport
All you have to do is print off the e-ticket and show it at the check-in desk.
ticket.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to produce and sell tickets for an event, journey etc
ticket.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: air travel sold and ticketed in the UK
ticket.translation[1].definitions[1].def: to give someone a ticket for parking their car in the wrong place, driving too fast etc
ticket.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: Drivers stopping here will be ticketed and have their cars towed.
ticket.translation[2].definitions[0].def: a printed piece of paper which shows that you have paid to travel on a bus or plane, enter a cinema, go to a sports game etc
ticket.translation[2].definitions[0].exa: The price includes theatre tickets and taxis.
The airline is offering frequent fliers a free ticket to Europe.
He bought a ticket for the show.
United Airlines has nearly 14,000 ticket agents.
